<p>
Hello and welcome! I am an incoming second-year MS student in the Quantitative Methods program at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (UIUC), advised by <a href="https://education.illinois.edu/profile/yan-xia" target="_blank">Dr. Xia</a>. I expect to graduate in Summer 2026 and am currently applying to Ph.D. programs in Quantitative Psychology for Fall 2026.
</p>

<p>
My research lies at the intersection of complex data structures and advanced statistical modeling, with three primary areas of focus:
</p>

<ul>
  <li>Improving the generalizability and robustness of Structural Equation Models (SEM).</li>
  <li>Extending the applicability of network analysis to uncover latent structures.</li>
  <li>Developing and evaluating adaptive regularization techniques, including nonconvex penalties and the Bayesian Lasso.</li>
  <li>Advancing statistical methodology for complex data types, including high-dimensional, textual, intensive longitudinal, missing, health, and process data.</li>
</ul>
